title: APACHE II Score
description: Estimates ICU mortality using physiological parameters, age, and chronic health status within 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Worst body temperature (rectal) in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: mean_arterial_pressure
parameters.description: Worst mean arterial pressure in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: ph
parameters.description: Worst arterial pH in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: heart_rate
parameters.description: Worst heart rate in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: respiratory_rate
parameters.description: Worst respiratory rate in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: sodium
parameters.description: Worst serum sodium in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: potassium
parameters.description: Worst serum potassium in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: creatinine
parameters.description: Worst serum creatinine in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: acute_renal_failure
parameters.description: Presence of acute renal failure (doubles creatinine points)

parameters.name: hematocrit
parameters.description: Worst hematocrit in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: white_blood_cell_count
parameters.description: Worst white blood cell count in first 24 hours of ICU admission

parameters.name: glasgow_coma_scale
parameters.description: Glasgow Coma Scale score (15 points = fully alert)

parameters.name: fio2
parameters.description: Fraction of inspired oxygen (as decimal, e.g., 0.21 for 21%)

parameters.name: chronic_health_status
parameters.description: History of severe organ system insufficiency or immunocompromised state

result.name: apache_ii_score
result.description: APACHE II score (0-71 points, higher scores indicate higher mortality risk)

ranges.interpretation: APACHE II score 0-9 points indicates low severity of illness with predicted mortality typically <10%. Patients in this range generally have a good prognosis for ICU survival.
APACHE II score 10-19 points indicates moderate severity of illness with predicted mortality typically 10-25%. Close monitoring and standard ICU care are appropriate.
APACHE II score 20-29 points indicates high severity of illness with predicted mortality typically 25-50%. Aggressive intensive care management is warranted.

APACHE II score 30-39 points indicates very high severity of illness with predicted mortality typically 50-75%. Maximum intensive care support and consideration of goals of care discussions may be appropriate.
APACHE II score ≥40 points indicates extremely high severity of illness with predicted mortality typically >75%. Consider palliative care consultation and careful evaluation of treatment goals.

references: Knaus WA, Draper EA, Wagner DP, Zimmerman JE. APACHE II: a severity of disease classification system. Crit Care Med. 1985;13(10):818-29. doi: 10.1097/00003246-198510000-00009. PMID: 3928249.
Vincent JL, Moreno R. Clinical review: scoring systems in the critically ill. Crit Care. 2010;14(2):207. doi: 10.1186/cc8204. PMID: 20392287.

Zimmerman JE, Kramer AA, McNair DS, Malila FM. Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation (APACHE) IV: hospital mortality assessment for today's critically ill patients. Crit Care Med. 2006;34(5):1297-310. doi: 10.1097/01.CCM.0000215112.84523.F0. PMID: 16540951.
formula: APACHE II = Acute Physiology Score (0-60) + Age Points (0-6) + Chronic Health Points (0-5). APS is sum of weighted scores for 12 physiological variables (temperature, MAP, HR, RR, oxygenation, pH, sodium, potassium, creatinine, hematocrit, WBC, GCS). Age points: ≤44y=0, 45-54y=2, 55-64y=3, 65-74y=5, ≥75y=6. Chronic health: 5 points for nonoperative/emergency operative, 2 points for elective operative if severe organ insufficiency or immunocompromised.
notes: Use the worst values within the first 24 hours of ICU admission
Score is not recalculated during stay - it is by definition an admission score
If patient is readmitted to ICU, calculate a new APACHE II score
For oxygenation: use PaO2 if FiO2 <0.5, use A-aDO2 if FiO2 ≥0.5
Chronic health criteria: liver cirrhosis with portal hypertension, NYHA Class IV heart failure, severe respiratory disease, dialysis dependence, or immunocompromised state
Score ranges 0-71, but rarely exceeds 55 in practice
Predicted mortality requires ICU admission diagnosis in addition to APACHE II score
